verses.roman:
veśyā kahe,--"kṛpā kari' karaha upadeśa
ki mora kartavya, yāte yāya bhava-kleśa"

synonyms: veśyā kahe—the prostitute said; kṛpā kari'-being merciful; karaha upadeśa—please give instructions; ki—what; mora kartavya—my duty; yāte—by which; yāya—go away; bhava-kleśa—all material tribulations.
translation: The prostitute said, "Kindly act as my spiritual master. Instruct me in my duty by which to get relief from material existence."
